meanings.definition: Not readily understood or grasped by the mind.
meanings.sent1: The math problem was nonintuitive for the students.
meanings.sent2: The concept of time zones can be nonintuitive for some people.
meanings.sent3: It was nonintuitive to think that cats could fly.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to quit her job was as nonintuitive as a fish climbing a tree.
meanings.sent5: The maze was designed to be intentionally nonintuitive to confuse the participants.

meanings.definition: Not intuitive; not easily understood or learned.
meanings.sent1: The new software had a nonintuitive interface.
meanings.sent2: The instructions for the game were nonintuitive and caused confusion.
meanings.sent3: It seemed nonintuitive to wear a swimsuit in the snow.
meanings.sent4: His approach to problem-solving was as nonintuitive as dancing backwards.
meanings.sent5: The nonintuitive design of the building made it difficult to navigate.
